title: Credit Analyst
description:
KEEP BUSINESS MOVING.USE NUMBERS. CREATE JOY. BMW FINANCIAL SERVICES.
Having an eye for detail and being particular about accurate numbers is essential to the smooth running of our business. We are looking for individuals to join our team of precise-minded people dedicated to adding value to our customers and to our business. So, if you’d thrive in a team that values high work standards and learning opportunities, where every team member is recognized and valued, join us in driving the future of operations in business mobility.
Credit Analyst.BMW Financial Services.
As a Credit Analyst, you will be responsible of processing and verifying credit applications, as well as informing the making of credit decisions, which take care of financial losses in the company.
Responsibilities.Responsible for verifying and ensuring compliance with established risk policies and standards.Verify and validate the terms of each analyzed request, ensuring the consistency of the information in the system and the documents sent.Responsible for responding to queries from our group of distributors, covering aspects of established systems and processes.Request and follow up on missing applications or the entry of incorrect information.Responsible for providing solutions, and implementing procedures to minimize risk, as well as improve performance within the department.Responsible for the credit review of the assigned retail volume.Ensure the monitoring of the processes of the established procedure manuals.Respond to inquiries from the distributor network, including inquiries via email, also assist with any issue related to the financing of the operation.
Qualifications and experience.Bachelor's degree in Engineering, Business Administration, Economy or Finance.+3 years of experience in Financial Services.Desirable experience in the Automotive Industry.Fluent in English language.Advanced Excel

title: Master Trainer - Electrical Testing / Energy Module
description:
Digitalisation, robotics, artificial intelligence – not science fiction but our daily business. Everything seems impossible until it has been done. Our Industry 4.0 experts work on digitalising the entire value chain. They develop ground-breaking production technologies and set new standards for connecting all workflows. Industry 4.0 goes beyond connecting man and machine: it connects all stages of production, our processes and our customers.

What awaits you?
Develop and implement training programs for various electrical tests (high-voltage, insulation, dielectric, source-sink) and create a comprehensive strategy for the Bodyshop, paint shop, and energy module production technologies.Collaborate with the planning department to ensure smooth integration and installation of equipment, including validation and acceptance procedures.Guarantee seamless integration of PLCs and line equipment with Shopfloor systems through accurate connection and parameterization.Provide comprehensive training to production personnel on automation concepts, programming, commissioning, and troubleshooting techniques.Oversee and execute maintenance activities, including firmware/hardware updates, program/logic modifications, network configurations, digitalization initiatives, and fostering an innovative mindset.

What should you bring along?
Bachelor’s degree in Electrical Engineering with a focus on controls engineering, electrical engineering, robot engineering, automotive/automation engineering, mechatronics, or a related field.6+ years of hands-on experience controls engineering or electrical testing development in the automotive industry or similar, preferably in production, planning or maintenance.Proven ability to effectively train and mentor technical teams.Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.Fluency in English.

Are you motivated and would you like to shape tomorrow's mobility with us?- Apply now!
At the BMW Group, we see diversity and inclusion in all its dimensions as a strength for our teams. Equal opportunities are a particular concern for us, and the equal treatment of applicants and employees is a fundamental principle of our corporate policy. That is why our recruiting decisions are also based on personality, experience and skills.Find out more about diversity at the BMW Group at: bmwgroup.jobs/diversity

title: Sen. Spec. Accounting
description:
FUTURE IS THE BEST INVESTMENT PROJECT.
SHARE YOUR PASSION.
Always under control, always with passion: those who want to shape the future need to keep track especially when it comes to goal-oriented corporate management. Thanks to extensive training and qualified teams, our finance colleagues create decisive added value for the BMW Group anew every day because they know what really counts.
Sen. Spec. Accounting.
As a Senior Specialist Accounting, you will be responsible for overseeing general accounting operations by controlling and verifying BMW FS transactions and financial statements.
Responsibilities.Account for BMW Leasing credit losses and reconcile with the contract management system.Reconcile the accounting system with the Retail Finance contract management system.Reconcile the portfolio of the San Luis Potosi Plant.Prepare and execute the necessary adjusting entries to clear the reconciling items in the General Ledger, including sufficient supporting documentation.Manage the company's fixed assets and their monthly depreciation.Account for fixed assets for BMW Leasing, including security deposits.Post extensions, terminations, transfers to inventory, sales and subsequent invoice generation in the accounting system.Oversee and manage the validation of the net clearing process for leasing contracts.Be responsible for the various entries for Standard Leasing, write-offs and retail reserves.Lead and coordinate the thorough research and analysis of reconciling items to ensure proper resolution within established guidelines.Reconcile accruals including depreciation for both entities.Be responsible for insurance related postings, including overseeing the collection of insurance commissions.Manage assignments, coordinate and respond to internal and external audit queries and independently follow up on open issues.
 Qualifications and experience.Bachelor's degree on Accounting or related field.5+ years of experience in accounting.3+ years of experience in banking or financial services industry.Experience in automotive industry (desirable).Customer service skills (active listening, problem solving and ethics).Microsoft Office skills (PowerPoint, Word and Excel).Fluent in English language.

title: Master Trainer - Controls Coordinator / Energy Module
description:
At BMW, it’s easy to stay right on track. Like every car on our production line. Innovative technologies and highly automated systems at the BMW Group ensure non-stop perfection every day. So that our production continues to run smoothly, we are looking for maintenance technicians for our plant in...

What awaits you? 

Develop and execute a comprehensive control training strategy for bodyshop, paintshop, and energy module production technologies.Own and manage all controls technologies and maintenance activities, including firmware/hardware updates, program/logic modifications, network configurations, and digitalization initiatives.Collaborate with the planning department on equipment integration, installation, validation, and acceptance processes.Drive equipment uptime and performance by analyzing downtime and faults, implementing preventive maintenance strategies, and leading improvement projects.
What should you bring along?

Bachelor's degree in Controls Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Robotics, Automotive/Automation Engineering, Mechatronics, or a related field.Minimum of 6 years of hands-on controls engineering experience in the automotive industry or a similar high-tech environment.Proven expertise in safety systems (PLC, robot, drives), preferably within a production, planning, or maintenance context.Fluency in English.
Are you motivated and would you like to shape tomorrow's mobility with us? - Apply now!
At the BMW Group, we see diversity and inclusion in all its dimensions as a strength for our teams. Equal opportunities are a particular concern for us, and the equal treatment of applicants and employees is a fundamental principle of our corporate policy. That is why our recruiting decisions are also based on personality, experience and skills.Find out more about diversity at the BMW Group at: bmwgroup.jobs/diversity.

title: Parts Advisor Apprentice
description:
BMW Park Royal is looking for an Aftersales Parts Advisor Apprentice.

Your role

We are currently recruiting for an Aftersales Customer Service (Parts Advisor) Trainee. The successful applicant will have the opportunity to work with one of the world's most prestigious and technologically advanced car manufacturers.

You will be working in a busy BMW/MINI Parts Department. Parts Advisor specific duties include:

 Interaction with both Trade and Retail customers – you will be working with customers on a daily basis both over the phone and face-to-face, to provide them with information and to sell them parts and accessories. Stock – this includes stock control and checks, as well as being responsible for ordering parts stock to be delivered at required times. Computer Systems – you will work on specialised computer systems, including computerised stock management systems and parts identification programmes. Vehicle Service / Sales support – you will support other Departments within the BMW Retailer, including workshop staff, to ensure they function effectively.

All Aftersales Customer Service (Parts Advisor) Trainees attend the BMW Group Academy UK in Berkshire for their off-the-job training. The apprenticeship will have a strong focus on the retail environment and the high customer service expectations of BMW & MINI customers, as well as Service Advisor specific training. The training takes place over a 12 month period at the BMW Group Academy and has been designed to suit both Parts and Service Advisor roles.

During the time spent at your BMW Retailer, a mentor will be allocated to oversee the work-based learning programme. A BMW representative will also visit on a 12 weekly basis to set performance targets and ensure any development needs are being met.

Requirements and prospects

Personal qualities

Successful Applicants Must Demonstrate The Following

 An enthusiasm for excellent customer service. An interest in the automotive industry. To have good communication and organisational skills. To be honest and trustworthy with a willingness to learn. To have a positive attitude and work ethic, with high level of professionalism to represent the BMW/MINI brand. To be able to work effectively as part of a team in a busy parts department, as well as having the capability to follow instructions and work individually.

Desired Qualifications

Applicants are required to have, or predicted to obtain, GCSE Grade A*-C / 9 - 4 / or Functional Skills Level 2 (or equivalent) in the following subjects:

 English Maths One other subject

Future prospects

On successful completion of the apprenticeship, you will be a qualified Parts Advisor. You will also gain a Level 2 Customer Service Practitioner. Following this, there are various opportunities for progression within the Retailer.

Things to consider

Successful applicants must be prepared to travel to the BMW Group Academy in Berkshire to complete their apprenticeship training. Training is completed in one-week blocks approximately once every two months as well as virtual classroom training online.

All training costs are covered by the BMW Retailer (travel, accommodation and food).

About The Employer

All Light Vehicle Technician, Aftersales Customer Service (Parts & Service) and Motorcycle Technician Apprentices will be employed at their local BMW Retailer, and will attend the BMW Group Academy for their training. The BMW Group Academy is based at Wokefield Park near Reading in Berkshire. All Bodyshop Technician (Paint & Panel) Apprentices will be employed at their local BMW Retailer or Bodyshop, and will attend our body training facility for their training. The body training facility is located in Milton Keynes.

Training provider

While the programme will focus around customer service skills, also embedded within the seven weeks training will include the current certification training courses for the Parts Advisor role. Additional technical and product awareness training will also be included.

Qualifications To Be Achieved

 Level 2 Customer Service Practitioner Parts Advisor Certification ERR (Employee Rights & Responsibilities) Workbook

Training provider

INSPIRO LEARNING LIMITED

Applications for this apprenticeship are being processed by BMW Group Academy
skills: ['Mathematics', 'Customer Service', 'Automotive', 'After-Sales', 'Workshops', 'Stock Control', 'Stock Management', 'Training Courses', 'Spare Automotive Parts', 'Communication']

title: Apprentice Aftersales Service Advisor
description:
BMW Park Royal is looking for an Aftersales Service Advisor Apprentice.

Your role

The successful applicant will have the opportunity to work with one of the world's most prestigious and technologically advanced car manufacturers. There are very few Customer Service Apprenticeships in the motor industry and the BMW programme is regarded as being the leader in delivering the ultimate customer experience.

You will be working in a busy BMW/MINI Service Department. Your role will be focused on dealing with customers who have high expectations and a varied range of needs and demands. As a result, you need to have exceptional interpersonal skills and be able to build rapport, as well as a desire to provide the highest level of customer service. This combined with excellent organisational and communication skills will enable you to deliver outstanding customer service, representing the high standards and reputation of the BMW/MINI brand.

Service Advisor Specific Duties Include

Working face-to-face with customers within the RetailerHandling calls to the Retailer, including booking and scheduling vehicle services and repairsEstimating time and costs associated with vehicle services and repairsHandling and responding to customer complaintsBeing involved with interpreting initial customer concerns and liaising with the vehicle techniciansLiaising with customers and keeping them updated of any additional work that may be requiredTracking customer vehicles through the workshop during service and repairAdvising customers on how to solve problems with their vehicles

All Aftersales Customer Service (Service Advisor) Trainees attend the BMW Group Academy UK in Berkshire for their off-the-job training. The apprenticeship will have a strong focus on the retail environment and the high customer service expectations of BMW & MINI customers, as well as Service Advisor specific training. The training takes place over a 12 month period at the BMW Group Academy and has been designed to suit both Parts and Service Advisor roles. During the time spent at your BMW Retailer, a mentor will be allocated to oversee the work-based learning programme. A BMW representative will also visit on a 12 weekly basis to set performance targets and ensure any development needs are being met.

EnglishmathsOne other subject

On successful completion of the apprenticeship, you will be a qualified Service Advisor. You will also gain a Level 2 Customer Service Practitioner. Following this, there are various opportunities for progression within the Retailer.

Things to consider

Successful applicants must be prepared to travel to the BMW Group Academy in Berkshire to complete their apprenticeship training. Training is completed in one-week blocks approximately once every two months. All training costs are covered by the BMW Retailer (travel, accommodation and food).

About The Employer

All Light Vehicle Technician, Aftersales Customer Service (Parts & Service) and Motorcycle Technician Apprentices will be employed at their local BMW Retailer, and will attend the BMW Group Academy for their training. The BMW Group Academy is based at Wokefield Park near Reading in Berkshire. All Bodyshop Technician (Paint & Panel) Apprentices will be employed at their local BMW Retailer or Bodyshop, and will attend our body training facility for their training. The body training facility is located in Milton Keynes.

Training provider

title: BMW Vehicle Technician
description:
Park Lane Aftersales is looking for a Vehicle Technician.

Your role

Working on the electrical and mechanical systems for a range of BMW & MINI models, every day will be packed with variety. With our diagnostic technology at your fingertips, you’ll inspect components for wear and tear, carry out technical maintenance, repair or replace parts, as well as verifying vehicle functions and their subsystems.

Your profile

Your technical or vocational training in an automotive retailer or similar environment will be backed by experience working with prestige vehicles. A full driving licence is essential. We’ll also expect you to be a team player who’s continually focused on the needs of customers. Be a BMW Certified Technician.

Working Hours

40 Hrs per week, Monday to Friday , 8.00am - 17.00pm.Saturday working ( as per rota).25 Days annual leave, plus bank holidays.

Rewards

BMW Group Car & Bike Scheme.BMW Group Pension Employer Contribution from 8% - 16%.BMW Career Progression.25 days plus public holidays. Access to exclusive company car scheme.

title: Sales Rep Mercedes Benz/BMW
description:
Go fast, take a chance, come grow with us!Passive Safety Systems (Division R) is carving out from ZF LIFETEC current portfolio to become an independent company. This will allow the Division to further grow and expand its market position in safety restraint technologies by involving external investors. Our footprint already includes ~45,000 employees in 20countries in 44 locations and 2022 sales exceeded €4.5 billion. Establishing a solid resource foundation for independency is key to future success to become the #1 market leader. Our mission is to help protect people on the road with innovative state-of-the-art inflatable restraint, seat belt and steering wheel systems technology. Now is your opportunity to shape the future of passive safety technologies together with us!
 ¡Come and join to the Passive Safety Systems Division as Sales Rep Mercedes Benz/BMW at Reynosa Plant! 
 ResponsibilitiesCustomer RFQ / GDPEP 1-2 (35%):Check and specify RFQ requirements/project goals for MB & BMW customers,Involve, coordinate, and drive internal stakeholders,Challenge internal stakeholder towards technical, economic, and quality requirements, create best technical and economic conditions,Define actions within framework of specified standards and guidelines,Drive and present all aspects of GDPEP 1-2, Preparing offer and/or be co-partner in offer process,Clarify any discrepancies and work out resolutions together with KAM/BAM team.
Sales Project Team Member (35%):Bring in commercial view, targets, and tasks,Drive change management, check and evaluate costs and present, if necessary, in CQA meetings, Track compliance with the goals (quality, costs, and deadlines), if necessary. Suggest and initiate corrective measures, pro-active coordination,Monitor success and report on the status of the project and account.
Administration (focus NA): 30%Track product CV and related POs in association with KAM/ BAM Team. Process POs in the ZF system, Maintain prototype order tracker with PO status, approve, track, and ensure goods receipt closure for prototype shipments, Work as liaison between MB & BMW and KAM/BAM Team, Engineering and Program Management to communicate issues with on-time deliveries, prototype purchase orders and other discrepancies,Record, track and determine quarterly raw material inflation, support KAM/BAM Team with Claim Recovery, Work with Finance and Accounts Receivable (A/R) departments to resolve invoice and payment issues. 
 Required Skills & ExperienceBachelor’s degree required, preferably in Business or related discipline. Requires 6-8 years of progressive experience in business with at least 3 years direct sales experience.Experience in working in a global, cross-functional organizational structure. Proactive cooperation to work with a wide variety of functions/individuals within and across the organization at all levels; internally and externally.Ability to juggle competing demands and adapt to different situations. Must be able to perform under stressful conditions and meet immediate or short-lead time deadlines.Thinks strategically and considers the long-term view.Be able to work in a high dynamic organization and to work under pressure. Team player as part of a global sales team.Strong in MS Office (Excel/PowerPoint/Word).Solid leadership, analytical, project management, facilitation, and problem-solving skills.Winning mentality and persuasion skills as well as a high level of integrity and professionalism.Energetic, responsive team player who is keen to take initiatives.Proactive, organized, and accuracy with attention to detail. Professional communications skills both verbally and in writing with mandatory fluency in English required.Domestic/International travel required on an as needed basis. Frequent travel required to support customer.

What We OfferBenefits above the lawMajor Medical Expenses InsuranceGlobal growth opportunitiesCompetitive Wages

title: Senior Vehicle Technician
description:
Park Lane Aftersales is looking for a Senior Technician.

Your role

You’ll work on electrical, electronic, hydraulic, pneumatic, and mechanical systems for a range of BMW & MINI models. With our diagnostic technology at your fingertips, you’ll inspect components for wear and tear, carry out technical maintenance, repair or replace parts, as well as verifying vehicle functions and their subsystems and performing retrofitting work. We’ll also look to you to support and guide other technicians and apprentices.

Your profile

Your technical or vocational training in an automotive retailer or similar environment will be backed by extensive experience working with prestige vehicles. A full driving licence is essential. A genuine team player who loves to share your knowledge with others, you’re continually focused on the needs of customers.

Working Hours

40 Hrs per week, Monday to Friday , 8.00am - 17.00pm.Saturday working ( as per rota).25 Days annual leave, plus bank holidays.

Rewards

BMW Group Car & Bike Scheme.BMW Group Pension Employer Contribution from 8% - 16%.BMW Career Progression.25 days plus public holidays. Access to exclusive company car scheme.
skills: ['Automotive', 'Automotive Electronics', 'Automotive Repair', 'Brakes', 'Customer Satisfaction', 'Oil Changes', 'Teamwork', 'Tire Sales', 'Troubleshooting', 'Vehicle Maintenance']

title: Customer Service (Automotriz BMW)
description:
CUSTOMER SERVICE (Automotriz BMW)
REQUISITOS:
Experiencia: 5 años como Customer Service en industria automotriz, manejo de portales de clientes (ideal conocer al cliente BMW).Idioma: Inglés Avanzado/ Fluido
CONOCIMIENTOS:SAP Avanzado
ACTIVIDADES:Recibir y analizar las demandas de los clientesAnalizar inventario, materiales y recursos para dar respuesta al ClienteVerificar que los requerimientos de clientes estén actualizados para su programación y producción (Integración de la demanda)Seguimiento del plan de producción de los clientes, a fin de garantizar el cumplimiento de este.Asegurar las entregas a tiempo coordinando todos los recursos internosAlta interacción con producción, almacén, embarque y comercio exteriorSeguimiento de nuevos proyectos.Generación de indicadores del áreaPortales de clientes
OFRECEMOS:Sueldo competitivo + Prestaciones Superiores a las de Ley (30 días de aguinaldo, 13% de FA, 13% vales de despensa (con tope legal ambos), 12 días de vacaciones, SV, SGMM, 70% prima vacacionalHorario de trabajo de 7:00 a 17:00 horas de lunes a jueves, viernes de 7:00 a 14:00 horasEmpleo presencial, ubicado en Parque Industrial Bernardo Quintana.

title: Master Technician
description:
BMW Park Royal is looking for a Master Technician.

Your role

You’ll work on electrical, electronic, hydraulic, pneumatic, and mechanical systems for a range of BMW & MINI models. With our diagnostic technology at your fingertips, you’ll inspect components for wear and tear, carry out technical maintenance, repair or replace parts, as well as verifying vehicle functions and their subsystems and performing retrofitting work. We’ll also look to you to support and guide other technicians and apprentices.

Your profile

Your technical or vocational training in an automotive retailer or similar environment will be backed by extensive experience of working with prestige vehicles. A full driving licence is essential. A genuine team player who loves to share your knowledge with others, you’re continually focused on the needs of customers.

The Successful Applicant Will Also Have The Following Qualifications

City & Guilds qualification. NVQ Level 2/3, Vehicle Maintenance – Service.Replacement, Level 3, Vehicle Mechanical and Electronic Systems - Maintenance and Repair.BMW ATA Master Technician status.IMI Level 4/5 Hybrid & Electric vehicle repair.

Working Hours

40 Hrs per week, Monday to Friday , 8.00am - 17.00pm.Saturday working ( as per rota).25 Days annual leave, plus bank holidays.

Rewards

BMW Group Car & Bike Scheme.BMW Group Pension Employer Contribution from 8% - 16%.BMW Career Progression.

title: Programador de PLC/Robots certificados por BMW
description:
Importante empresa dedicada a soluciones de automatización, se encuentra en búsqueda de Programadores de robots certificados por BMW para un proyecto temporal en Charleston, Carolina del Sur, Estados Unidos. 

Los candidatos seleccionados serán responsables de la programación, configuración y puesta en marcha de sistemas de automatización industrial, garantizando el cumplimiento de los estándares de calidad y seguridad establecidos por BMW y nuestros proveedores de tecnología.

Responsabilidades y funciones principales:

Programar y configurar sistemas de PLC y robots de acuerdo con los estándares y especificaciones técnicas de BMW.Realizar pruebas y validaciones de sistemas, asegurando la funcionalidad y eficiencia de los mismos.Colaborar con equipos de ingeniería y proveedores para solucionar problemas técnicos y optimizar procesos.Documentar procedimientos y configuraciones, manteniendo registros precisos y actualizados.

Requisitos:

Visa TN vigente para trabajar en los Estados Unidos.Disponibilidad para trabajar por un proyecto de 1 mes en Charleston, Carolina del sur, Estados Unidos.Obligatorio poseer certificaciones de BMW en: SAS-Hardware/EPLAN.WTB SAS/ SOV Basic Controls.TKB Commissioning trainingCertificaciones: KUKA Prog.1KUKA Safe Operation training por KUKA

Experiencia: 

Conocimientos Técnicos:SAS E-plan y SAS export files: Dominio en el uso y manejo de archivos de exportación SAS (carpeta de commissioning) es esencial.Manejo de EPLAN: Competencia en el uso de software EPLAN para la planificación y documentación de proyectos eléctricos y de automatización.Experiencia en Robótica: Habilidad para trabajar con proveedores de robótica y manejar adecuadamente los archivos y configuraciones necesarias para la integración de sistemas.

Estudios:  Ingeniería en software, Ingeniería Electrónica Industrial y Automática o Técnico Superior en Automatización y Robótica Industrial.

Idiomas: Inglés Intermedio (habilidad para comunicarse de manera efectiva en inglés, tanto escrito como hablado).

Ofrecemos:

Sueldo base conforme a la experiencia demostrada. Oportunidad de trabajar en un entorno dinámico y especializado. Los programadores de robots recibirán capacitación A01 en la planta de BMW.
